resolved_points: JPM has the widest moat in US banking
Credit normalization is occurring (NCO rising to 0.9-1.1%)
Dimon succession is a real risk (3-7% valuation impact)
unresolved_points: Fee income trajectory (Bull: +15% CAGR, Bear: +3%, Base: +6%)

key_points.analyst: Initial HOLD at $256.80, 3.3% upside. Quality premium justified but NII headwinds.
key_points.bull: IB recovery understated (30-40% not 15-20%), AWM hidden gem, tech payoff. Bull should be 30% prob.
key_points.bear: NII cliff steeper than feared, credit cycle has room to worsen, office CRE landmine, multiple compression risk.
key_points.critic: IB assumes all M&A closes (historical 85%), AWM 5-7% organic unrealistic, card NCO comparison uses benign period.

key_points.synthesis: NII trajectory: $85-90B likely. Credit NCO adjusted to 1.0% from 0.9%. Multiple range 1.8-2.2x.

key_points.bull: Payments deserves premium multiple ($127B standalone), share repurchase value accretion, First Republic synergies.
key_points.bear: IB backlog not equal to revenue, payments competition intensifying, buybacks at rich valuations destroy value.
key_points.critic: Payments valuation uses tech multiples inappropriately, buybacks neutral at 2.1x P/TBV, credit card fee cap valid risk.

key_points.analyst: Revised model: IB growth 22%, NII $86B, card NCO 2.9%, Dimon 5% terminal discount. Fair value $253.40.

key_points.bull: Private credit partnership, AI cost savings (20% efficiency gains), international growth, TBV growth 8% supports $279.
key_points.bear: Private credit adds risk, AI could help competitors, international currency/geopolitical risk, structural ROTCE 15-16%.
key_points.critic: Private credit realistic but 5+ year timeframe, AI reinvestment rate 60-70%, execution risk on international.

key_points.synthesis: Mid-debate consensus on moat (wide), NII decline, credit normalization. Unresolved: ROTCE, fees, terminal multiple.
Valuation highly sensitive to terminal multiple (0.2x P/TBV = $24/share). Fair value range $235-$280.

key_points.bull: Relative valuation supports premium (500bp ROTCE above peers), 2006-2007 P/TBV was 2.5-3.0x.
key_points.bear: Peers cheap for reasons (BAC rate sensitivity, WFC asset cap), 2006-2007 comparison dangerous (ended in 50% drawdown).

key_points.critic: Premium 60% structural, 40% cyclical. Fair terminal P/TBV = 1.85x. Adjusted fair value $255.

key_points.synthesis: Final values: Super Bear $165, Bear $205, Base $260, Bull $310, Super Bull $375. Prob-weighted $256.80. HOLD rating.
